title: Senators quiz social networks - BBC News
summary: ftse 100 rises a touch to 7,493 points .
fixed-odds maximum stake may be cut .

documents.title: good night
text: that 's all from business live for the last day of october - it 's less than two months to christmas folks !
we are back bright and early tomorrow at 06:00 so do join us then .
thanks for reading .

documents.title: struggling sears

documents.title: nasdaq at new high
text: wall street has ended higher , with the nasdaq at a new record following strong us economic data and ahead of the release of a tax cut proposal in congress .
us consumer confidence hit a 17-year high in october , while sales of single-family homes spiked in september , hitting their highest level in a decade .
the dow jones industrial average finished up 0.1 % at 23,377.2 points , while the s & p 500 rose 0.1 % to 2,575.2 .
the technology-focused nasdaq composite jumped 0.4 % to 6,727.6 despite a near-10 % fall for toy maker mattel and a 6.7 % fall for chip maker qualcomm , which is emboiled in a row with apple .

documents.title: big
text: cnn 's dylan byers gives a nice summation of the issues at stake here in these tweets .
you can watch the hearing live on the senate website , by the way .
big picture : d.c. and silicon valley have drastically different priorities : tech companies want to be open platforms .
dc wants rules , limits
true story - an activist friend of mine and i tried to get a group of funders to let us do the same kind of micro-targeted ads for hrc .
sigh
this seems pretty intuitive , no ?
this gives me pause .
the platform houses the info .
but i do n't believe that giving carte blanc power to corporations is right .
just my $ .2
if we give up our freedoms when we sign their user agreement , what diff does it make ?
more rules/limits on ads/campaign transparency
this is so much bigger than ads .
the point is these platforms do n't have adequate checks/balances to stop foreigners from political meddling
maybe i am being naive but with the 1st amendment , how do you stop foreign meddling ?
you can stop paid ads , but meddling ?
if you 're calling for banning users , for non-paid content you 're attacking the 1st amend that is categorically insane , not happening .
these platforms also have zero respect for legitimate journalism .
so why do news outlets use the same stories on their shows ? ? ?

documents.title: million dollar question
text: more from recode on the senate hearing :
and there it is .
sen. mazie hirono asked the million dollar question to facebook : # techhearings
a company built on quantifying info about people & influencing them should be able to quantify info about people & their influences
this is a catchy q , but real research is : do results depart significantly from past trends , be accounted for by current election trends .
i do n't think the challenge is to quantify , at all .
it 's hard to philosophize about voters as dummy actors in a stimulus/response loop .
interesting that facebook normally touts its ability to analyze data .
hmmmm
and the $ 2 obvious answer , `` virtually impossible to quantify . ''
how people sneer at claims & puffery and then seriously expect it to be met .
it 's hard to believe so many people were so heavily influenced , maybe we need internet licenses before people can login

documents.title: content ? what content
text: representatives from google and twitter agree that they are not in the content creation business - although facebook is less clear cut :
twitter and google reps just said they 're not in the content business .
facebook more or less acknowledged it is .
a company with a biz model selling advertising is a media business .
silicon valley has a hard time accepting that but technology !

documents.title: the wrong issue ?
text: facebook 's general counsel hesitates about senator franken 's question about banning political ads paid for in currencies such as roubles because it may not solve the problem .
ft reporter hannah kuchler tweets :
senators seem obsessed with the fact the russians paid in roubles .
politicians and tech really are n't speaking the same language .
franken : `` my goal is for you to think through this stuff a little bit better ''

documents.title: reading the roubles
text: senator al franken says the three tech companies in question were the `` canary in the coalmine '' in 2016 .
he asks how facebook , which can process billions of data points into personal connections for users , failed to see that electoral ads paid for in roubles were coming from russia .
`` american political ads and russian money - how could you not connect those dots ? ''
facebook 's general counsel responds : `` we should have been alert to and in hindsight , it 's one we missed . ''

documents.title: time warp
text: senator chris coons from delaware asks the facebook general counsel :
sen. coons : why has it taken facebook 11 months to come forward when former president obama cautioned your ceo after the election ? ''
you mean obama , the moral authority ?
that 's pretty funny .
yes , the president whose campaign manager was n't indicted for crimes against the united states .
that guy .
the first president to not be under congressional/federal investigation since jimmy carter .
that guy .
`` zuckerberg struck down the notion as a `` crazy idea '' that `` surely had no impact '' on the end result . ''
i deactivated my fb .
maybe everyone else should follow my lead ?
whadduusay ?
exactly , twitter and fb knew that russians were hacking us and yet refused to admit it until they got caught
nope , sadly one thing that has come out from all this is that some ppl do believe ridiculous , sensational , and can not get enough of it .
these fuckers answer only to their keepers who in turn only answer to the almighty $ $ $ $ $ $ $ $ $ $ .
ffs .
before the election , i believe he was cautioned last summer ?
we were busy with zuck photo ops in iowa .
why did n't obama 's fbi warn trump during the campaign ?
simple answer .
pres .
obama wanted to go after those that disrupted the election .
trump says fake news & really do n't care .
he won by default

documents.title: set 'em up , knock 'em down
text: the effort to `` sow division and discord '' continued in the wake of the us presidential election , says facebook general counsel colin stretch .
`` we saw a lot of activity directed at fomenting discord about the validity of his [ mr trump 's ] election , '' he tells senators .
`` it continued until we disabled the accounts . ''

but he adds that the total number of ads on facebook that were from the russian government-linked internet research agency was about 0.004 % of the content in news feeds during the time period in question .

documents.title: no honest ads , thanks
text: technology news website recode tweets :
will facebook , google and twitter support the honest ads act ?
not one of them said yes .
# techhearings
will the left wing media support the honest ads act the dnc/hillary campaign claims they do n't know who paid for trump dossier

documents.title: nothing to see here
text: google 's law enforcement and internet security chief , richard salgado , says the search giant only found two accounts it suspected of being linked to russian government-backed entities , which spent about $ 4,700 in connection with the 2016 election .
on youtube , which google owns , there were 18 channels with 1,100 videos that it suspected were associated with the russian government .
mr salgado ( says : `` we believe that the relatively limited amount of activity that we found is a result of the safeguards that we had in place in advance of the election .
google 's products also do n't lend themselves to the kind of targeting or viral dissemination that these actors seem to prefer . ''

documents.title: the elephant in the room
text: none of the senators have yet asked the big question , cnn 's dylam byers adds :
nearly 90 minutes in and no senator has asked facebook / google / twitter if they 've seen evidence of collusion btwn trump campaign & russia
why is # senate not asking them why they do n't stop # isis accounts ?
we spent 1yr on fake russian meddling , while isis breads/spreads online !
isis social media accounts allow the u.s. to keep tabs on these organizations .
i see what you mean.that makes sense but how do we stop people from getting radicalized online ? i guess those are the pages that do such harm
we have to stop alienating muslims .
when we alienate people they turn to the internet for refuge .
if that means `` playing nice '' so be it .
because they already know the answer to the question is no .
you 're so precious .
let me know how you feel when the next indictments are unsealed
why did n't they ask the question then ?
what about clinton and uranium one ?
because there is n't
been watching hearings all year .
quality of question is mediocre at best .
angus king is best of the bunch .
could that be a prenegotiated ground rule of the testimony ?

documents.title: disclosure ?
text: cnn reporter dylan byers tweets about questioning from amy klobuchar , a former prosecutor who is the senior senator from minnesota :
sen. klobuchar honing in on big issue : steps facebook , twitter , google taking would not prevent issues ads , which is what russian ads were
watching
'homing in '
which btw makes them almost impossible to police .
it 's what happens after the click on the `` issues '' ad , that is where message gets real .
have you seen them ?
sen. klobuchar , in short : there 's really no reason why you ca n't put disclosures on issues ads , same as political ads .

documents.title: twitter 'troubled by reports of russian interference in trump election '
text: sean edgett , acting general counsel for twitter , says on russian disinformation in the 2016 election :

`` we are troubled by reports that the power of twitter was misused by a foreign actor for the purpose of influencing the us presidential election and undermining public faith in the democratic process .
the abuse of our platform to attempt state sponsored manipulation of elections is a new challenge for us , and one that we are determined to meet ``
`` at the time of the 2016 election , we observed instances and acted on them of automated and malicious activity .
as we learned more about the scope of the broader problem , we resolved to strengthen out systems . ''

documents.title: facebook 's actions against the 'bad actors '
text: in aggregate these ads and posts were `` a very small fraction of the overall content on facebook , but any amount is too much '' , says colin stretch , facebook 's general counsel .

so facebook is hiring more ad reviewers , doubling engineering security efforts , tightening ad content restrictions , increasing ad transparency , requiring more information from political ad buyers , and developing artificial intelligence to help locate `` banned content and bad actors '' , mr stretch adds .

documents.title: facebook lawyer on fake news
text: facebook 's general counsel mr stretch continues : `` our investigation , which continues to this day , we have found that foreign actors used fake accounts to place ads on facebook and instagram that reached millions of americans over a two year period , and that those ads were used to promote pages , which in turn posted more content .
people shared these posts , spreading them still further .
many of these ads and posts are inflammatory .
some are downright offensive , and much of it will be particularly painful to communities that engaged with this content believing it to authentic . ''

documents.title: facebook lawyer : russia interference 'reprehensible '
text: some strong stuff also from colin stretch , the general counsel for facebook , on russia 's interference in the us presidential election :
`` when it comes to the 2016 election , i want to be clear - we take what happened on facebook very seriously .
the foreign interference we saw is reprehensible .

that foreign actors hiding behind fake accounts abused our platform and other internet services to try and sow divisions and dischord , and to try to undermine the election is directly contrary to our values and goes against everything facebook stands for . ''

documents.title: social networks in for a grilling
text: strong stuff from the senators on the senate committee on the judiciary who are interviewing representatives from tech giants facebook , twitter and google on russian interference in the 2016 us presidential elections .

republican senator lindsay graham says : `` to those who wish to undermine the american way of life , they found portals into our society that are intermingled with everyday life , and the challenge of this hearing , this focus is , how do we keep the good , and deal with the bad ? ''
democrat senator sheldon whitehouse says : `` our adversaries have access to tools well beying traditional political advertising .
they are using our own social networks , or friendships , our families , our biases and view points against us to ahcieve their political ends . ''

documents.title: oil near two-year high
text: oil prices were slightly up after a week of gains as the prospect of increasing us exports dampened sentiment that has driven brent crude to more than two-year highs above $ 60 per barrel .
brent crude was up 27 cents or 0.5 % at $ 60.86 a barrel , close to its july 2015 highs reached earlier this week , and up around 37 % from its 2017 lows hit in june .

documents.title: netflix suspends house of cards
text: netflix said yesterday that the sixth season of house of cards would be the last for the drama starring kevin spacey .
but in the wake of allegations made against the actor , the streaming service says today it is suspending production of the show indefinitely .

producer media rights capital and netflix `` have decided to suspend production on house of cards season six , until further notice , to give us time to review the current situation and to address any concerns of our cast and crew '' , a joint statement said .
mr spacey also been dropped as the recipient of a special emmy award he was due to receive next month .
author: Chris Johnston
Business reporter, BBC News

documents.title: brexit minister says 'basic ' eu deal likely even if trade talks fail
text: brexit minister david davis said on tuesday he believed britain would agree some kind of basic deal with the european union , even in the `` very improbable '' scenario a trade deal can not be reached .

mr davis told a parliamentary committee that even if britain failed to strike a formal trade deal both sides were likely to have agreements in areas such as aviation that would allow planes to fly between britain and the eu .
it is `` not impossible , but very , very improbable '' that britain and the eu will fail to agree a brexit deal , mr davis said .
`` whatever happens we will have a basic deal without the bits we really want , '' he said .

documents.title: russia-linked posts 'reached 126m facebook users in us '
text: facebook has said as many as 126 million american users may have seen content uploaded by russia-based operatives over the past two years .
the social networking site said about 80,000 posts were produced before and after the 2016 presidential election .
most of the posts focused on divisive social and political messages .
facebook released the figures ahead of a senate hearing where it , together with twitter and google .
will detail russia 's impact on the popular sites .
read more here .

documents.title: trump 'not looking to phase in corporate tax cut '
text: president donald trump has said he is not looking for the corporate tax rate reduction that the white house seeks to be phased in over time .
`` hopefully not , '' mr trump told reporters when asked about the issue during a meeting on tax reform at the white house .
mr trump said he wanted a tax reform bill passed by the us thanksgiving holiday , which is in late november .

documents.title: 'inspirational leader '
text: channel 4 has now announced ian katz 's appointment as director of programmes .
chief executive alex mahon says : `` ian is an inspirational leader who assiduously builds and nurtures talented and empowered teams .
he has fantastic instincts and intelligence , huge editorial strength and is a proven creative and digital innovator , who lives and breathes the channel 4 values . ''

documents.title: katz leaves newsight

some industry observers have expressed surprise at the decision by c4 's new boss , alex mahon , given mr katz 's career has been in newspapers - namely the guardian - rather than television before joining newsnight .

documents.title: net firms invest in trans-pacific cable project
text: big net firms invest in trans-pacific cable project

documents.title: british airways cabin staff vote to accept pay deal
text: british airways cabin crew have voted to accept a pay deal , bringing an end to a long-running dispute which included 85 days of industrial action .

unite said 84 % of its members backed the deal , adding that staff in `` mixed fleet '' cabin crew will receive increases of between £ 1,404 to £ 2,908 by next march depending on experience and subject to inflation .
the union said the deal sees travel concessions and bonus entitlements returned to cabin crew who took industrial action .

unite general secretary len mccluskey said : `` a great deal of credit should go to unite members and their shop stewards in british airways ' mixed fleet for their determination and solidarity in securing this settlement .
a ba spokesman said : `` we are pleased the dispute has been resolved . ''

documents.title: what us rules does airbus think it broke ?
text: airbus says it has discovered and reported to us authorities certain inaccuracies in past declarations to the state department over the sale of defence goods and services under the international traffic in arms regulations ( itar ) .
the 40-year-old set of rules governs the export of defence goods and data .
the itar rules also have transparency requirements set out in part 130 of the regulations which airbus says it may have breached .

companies dealing in itar-controlled goods must declare the use of sales agents or the payment of political contributions over $ 5,000 or commissions over $ 100,000 to the state dept 's directorate of defense trade controls .

documents.title: head to head
text: earlier , french gdp figures showed the country 's economy expanded at its fastest pace since 2011 in the third quarter after a boost from consumer spending and robust investment .
but how does recent french and uk gdp growth stack up ?
as can be seen , the figures are pretty volatile , but france has been growing faster than the uk this year .

documents.title: 'a million homes still at risk from deadly tumble dryers '
text: a million homes still at risk from deadly tumble dryers
when channel 5 launched years ago , someone visited every home to adjust tv sets .
do the same searching for dangerous dryers .

documents.title: us trade panel set to recommend solar trade tariffs
text: federal officials will recommend policies to penalise lower cost solar panel imports into the us after complaints from us solar panel firms .
trade interventions were requested earlier this year by two small us manufacturers that say they are not able to compete with cheap panels made overseas , mainly in asia .

the us international trade commission has voted to put forward proposals including tariffs , a quota or other trade remedies to president donald trump , who will make a final decision later this year .
fears of steep new tariffs on imports have sparked widespread nervousness among solar developers and installers that have benefited from a 70 % drop in the cost of solar since 2010 .
many snapped up panels ahead of the itc 's vote and warned that some projects may not be completed if the cost of panels rises too much .

documents.title: listen : young and in business
text: juggling school work and running your own business .
two successful 15-year old entrepreneurs share their experiences with business daily on bbc world service .

izzi dymalovski founded her skin care brand 'luv ur skin ' in australia when she was just 9 years old and silicon valley inventor shubham banerjee has secured funding from the likes of intel for his company 'braigo labs ' , which is making a low-cost braille printer for the blind .
plus , the programme speaks to aurore hochard , head of entrepreneurship programmes at cass business school in london , about why business founders are getting younger and younger .
author: BBC World Service

documents.title: dvd rental in the streaming age
text: for some , this halloween will be a darker day than those past because on 31 october lovefilm by post , the dvd rental service , will finally cease to trade .
for tara judah , a co-director of a movie rental shop in bristol , it is a day of triumph .
`` we just outlived lovefilm so that 's pretty good in my book , '' she says .
one of the last remaining film rental stores in the uk , 21st century flicks has been trading since 1982 - the era of vhs video tapes .
however , ms judah is under no illusions about the future of a business that is an increasingly diminished player in an arena dominated by film and tv streaming giants such as netflix .
ms judah tells bbc radio 5 live that she and her two co-directors in 21st century flicks , a dvd rental shop in bristol , `` do it for the love of it , not the money .
i think that 's the most important thing '' .
read dearbail 's full story here

documents.title: sterling boosted by barnier comments
text: on the currency markets the pound is up by 0.27 % against the dollar at $ 1.3244 .
it 's also higher against the euro by 0.38 % at 1.1381 euros .
the currency 's received a boost after the european union 's chief brexit negotiator , michel barnier , said he was ready to speed up brexit talks .
mr barnier said that the agenda and dates for the next round of brexit talks would be set `` in ( the ) next few hours or days '' .

documents.title: checking in at singapore 's new 'contactless ' airport terminal
text: singapore 's changi airport launches operations at its new terminal 4 this week .
a key feature , say airports bosses , is its automated check-in system , which allows passengers to check in and board without having to talk to counter staff .
karishma vaswani gives us a walk-through .
video produced by christine hah , filmed by vince sia and edited by fahmi jamal .

documents.title: eurozone recovery gathering steam ?
text: the economy of the eurozone grew by 0.6 % in the third quarter of the year according to new official figures ( see earlier post ) .
unemployment edged down .
inflation declined as well , although the european central bank , which sets interest rates for the region , regards it as currently too low .
overall these new figures reinforce the of an economic recovery in the eurozone gaining some strength .
growth has up in the last year or so .
unemployment remains quite high at 8.9 % , but it has continued its decline from even higher levels .
price rises slowed last month to 1.4 % , taking inflation further away from the european central bank 's target .
very low inflation can make it harder for a central bank to respond if there 's a downturn , and the ecb is trying to get price rises to up .
author: Andrew Walker
World Service economics correspondent

documents.title: oil and gas reserves lower than thought
text: the oil and gas offshore industry regulator has reduced its estimates of the amount of known oil and gas left under uk waters .
the amount in known reserves and capable of extraction has dropped from 6.3 billion barrels to 5.7 billion , over the year to the end of 2016 .
the central estimate by the oil and gas authority ( oga ) was 7.8 billion barrels at the end of 2014 .
that was when the oil price had just begun to fall .
read more here

documents.title: fish under threatbbc scotland business and economy editor tweets
text: fish fry : warming waters test the resilience of haddie n cod :

documents.title: london markets tread water
text: there 's little movement on the london markets this lunchtime .
the ftse 100 is at 7,494.08 , a rise of just 6 points , or 0.08 % .
oil giant bp has gained 2.34 % following its q3 results , which revealed its profits had doubled .
meanwhile , communications group wpp - which fell following the release of its third quarter results , is now trading 1.93 % higher .
the two biggest losers are miners glencore , down by 1.92 % and fresnillo , which has dropped by 1.42 % .
the ftse 250 is at 20,198.46 , a fall of 15 points or 0.07 % .

documents.title: pfizer third quarter profits more than double
text: us pharmaceutical giant pfizer has said third quarter profit more than doubled on the back of newer drugs to treat cancer and other illnesses .
net income was $ 2.8bn , against just under $ 1.4bn a year earlier , a quarter that was hit with one-time expenses connected to pfizer acquisitions .
revenues edged up 0.9 % to $ 13.2bn .

documents.title: a taste of the future after brexit ?
text: something to chew on
if you need to convert any psd to responsive html , please feel free to contact .

documents.title: bailey : brexit decisions approaching for uk financial firms
text: fca boss andrew bailey tells the treasury select committee that uk-based financial firms are going to have to make some difficult decisions soon about where they are going to be located after brexit .
he said that while things such as the hiring of office space overseas in european union nations was reversible , issues around the hiring and relocation of staff were not .
mr bailey said that firms would want to know well in advance of 1 april 2019 which staff might be prepared to move abroad should companies choose to relocate .
and - if there was a shortfall in those moving - firms would want to know what their hiring demands in tighter overseas jobs markets were .
`` we tend to take the view that the end of this year , beginning of next year is the point at which these things start happening , '' mr bailey said .

documents.title: rbs must get 'act together ' over grg redress
text: more from the grilling of fca chief executive andrew bailey .
a compensation scheme has been set up to offer redress to customers of grg and mr bailey said he has asked rbs boss ross mcewan `` to get his act together '' regarding their claims .
`` i do believe we are now in the process of getting money back to the victims , '' fca chairman john griffith-jones added .
meanwhile , the regulator 's probe into grg was continuing mr bailey said , without outlining any dates or structure for the ongoing inquiry .
`` it depends where it leads to , frankly .
it could lead to enforcement action , '' he said .

documents.title: 'no meeting of minds ' on grg report
text: rbs 's global restructuring group ( grg ) had been accused by customers of driving them to bankruptcy in order to up their assets cheaply .
the fca published a detailed summary of consultant promontory 's report into grg last week , but not the complete report .
fca boss andrew bailey has told treasury select committee 's chair nicky morgan why the watchdog has taken so long to report back on grg .
mr bailey said there had been `` no meeting of minds '' between rbs and promontory .
this meant that the fca had to spend time checking the report , mr bailey added .

documents.title: fca report 'strongly critical ' of rbs
text: andrew bailey , chief executive of the financial conduct authority ( fca ) , told mps on the treasury select committee he believed rbs should have reacted differently to the conclusions of the report into its behaviour .
`` the report is strongly critical of rbs , and i think it is frankly unfortunate that rbs has not in a sense accepted that more readily , '' he said .

documents.title: what makes a whisky cask worth £ 500,000 ?
text: just how much would you pay for a cask of rare scotch whisky ?
for some , it seems , the sky is the limit when it comes to liquid gold .
earlier this month , an anonymous buyer in hong kong paid an auction-record £ 285,000 for a sherry cask filled with a 30-year-old macallan single malt .
its contents , if emptied , would work out at a neat £ 1,000 per 70cl bottle .
others have paid even more for a cask of the hard stuff , with one scotch whisky brokerage reporting a sale in excess of £ 500,000 .
read more on this story here .

documents.title: fca says has to establish fault before blame
text: the financial conduct authority is up before the treasury select committee .
chairman john griffith-jones is asked about the three year delay in publishing its report into the royal bank of scotland 's global restructuring group which dealt with struggling businesses
the global restructuring group was found to have `` widespread '' mistreatment of customers in some areas .
last week the financial regulator has said it may take `` further action '' over the way rbs mistreated some small business customers .
mr griffith-jones says the priority has been to get the money back to the victims .
as to how the delay looks to the public he acknowledged that it was clearly unfortunate that it could n't be done before .
the `` administration of regulatory justice does require us to establish fault before we get into the blame process , '' he adds .

documents.title: european union grows as well
text: more on those better than expected eurozone and european union economic growth figures now

seasonally adjusted gdp rose by 0.6 % in both the 19-nation euro area and in the 28-nation european union during the third quarter of 2017 , compared with the previous quarter , according to a preliminary flash estimate published by eurostat , the statistical office of the european union .
in the second quarter of 2017 , gdp grew by 0.7 % in both zones .
compared with the third quarter in 2016 , seasonally adjusted gdp rose by 2.5 % in both the euro area and in the eu28 .

documents.title: eurozone grows by 0.6 % bbc world service economics correspondent tweets
text: eurozone data out .
unemployment down a bit ( but still pretty high ) at 8.9 % , q3 growth 0.6 % ( first estimate ) and inflation down to 1.4 % ( ecb wants higher )

documents.title: how can financial firms continue to trade post-brexit ?
text: the bank of england is warning that 75,000 jobs could be lost from the uk 's financial services sector - if the uk leaves the european union without a trade deal .
senior figures at the bank of england are said to be using the number as a `` reasonable scenario '' in their planning for the future .
inga beale , the chief executive of lloyd 's of london , tells bbc news that the forecast was being taken seriously :
it feels all around you that this could be real .

businesses are having to plan , to think about how they can actually continue to trade post-brexit , and no business likes uncertainly and no customer likes uncertainty and none of our business want uncertainty .
so i can tell you , all of the financial services companies are thinking about what do they need to do as individual firms to ensure that they can continue to trade after brexit .

documents.title: important consumers get 'best deal ' says ofgem
text: reducing environmental damage from generating electricity and using gas to heat homes and businesses is one of ofgem 's five strategic aims .
the uk is committed to reducing its greenhouse gas emissions by 80 % of 1990 levels by 2050 .
in its state of the energy markets report the regulator says since the 2008 climate change act more than half of the reduction in the uk 's greenhouse gas emissions came from cleaner electricity .
`` however , there has been limited progress in reducing emissions from heat and transport , '' it says .
carbon prices now make coal unprofitable , which has been crucial to its recent decline in the `` generation mix '' and renewables produced 25 % of all electricity in 2016 , supported by subsidies .
investment in renewable technology is getting substantially cheaper , says ofgem .
however , many renewables contracts `` have been issued with limited or no competition , increasing costs to consumers .
`` the need for more low-carbon generation makes it even more important that consumers get the best deal , '' adds ofgem .

documents.title: breakingburberry boss bailey to step down at end of year
text: burberry has today announced that chief executive christopher bailey will leave the company at the end of 2018 .

a statement from the firm says : `` as burberry begins the next decade of its journey , christopher has concluded that after 17 years it will be the right time for him to pursue new creative projects .
`` christopher will remain president and chief creative officer until 31 march 2018 , when he will step down from the board .
he will provide his full support to chief executive officer marco gobbetti and the team on the transition until 31 december 2018 . ''

documents.title: 'vulnerable consumers lose out '
text: ofgem 's report also looks at the difficulties faced by some consumers in paying their bills .
it says last year the the average dual fuel bill for a customer of one of the six largest suppliers was £ 1,123 , 16 % lower than its peak in 2013 in real terms .
households with the lowest incomes spend 10 % of their expenditure on energy - over three times more than the proportion spent by households with highest incomes .
however , it adds the proportion of energy consumers in debt to their supplier is `` at its lowest level since we started collecting data in 2006 , but some still face very high debts '' .
and some groups of `` vulnerable consumers lose out '' .
`` nearly half of consumers who are unemployed , or have intermittent , semi- or low-skilled work , have never switched supplier , compared to under a third of other consumers .
`` this means that they are more likely to be on expensive standard variable tariffs , despite being less able to afford them . ''

documents.title: ofgem : energy competition benefiting some but not all
text: ofgem has just published its annual state of the energy markets report.undefined
it spells out the importance of `` effective competition '' which it says encourages firms to be more efficient and ensures energy markets work in the interests of consumers .
in the first chapter of the report ofgem concludes that `` competition continues to benefit household consumers who are able and willing to shop around , meaning they can usually get a good deal '' .

however `` less active '' consumers do n't get the benefits and 60 % of consumers are on a `` default variable tariff , which can be around £ 300 more expensive each year than the cheapest fixed-term deals '' .
also ofgem says retail markets ty work well for larger businesses , but small and micro-businesses pay much more on average .
in 2014 , ofgem referred the energy market to the competition regulator , the cma , because it felt the market was n't functioning as well as it should .
the cma reported in june 2016 and ofgem now says that the cma remedies , intended to improve `` competition and outcomes for consumers '' , are starting to work .

documents.title: nintendo stock jumps in muted japan session
text: shares of nintendo rallied in japanese trading as investors cheered an upbeat profit forecast from the video game maker .
the company said late monday it would nearly double its full-year profit guidance , sending shares up 3.4 % on tuesday .
the gains stood out in a lacklustre japanese session .
the benchmark nikkei 225 index was almost unchanged at 22,011.61 .
elsewhere in asia , south korea 's kospi closed up 0.9 % at 2,523.43 , while hong kong 's hang seng index dropped 0.3 % to end at 28,245.54 .

documents.title: bookies say government should n't gamble with jobssays review into fixed odds betting machines 'might not work '
text: losing 12,000 jobs , losing half the betting shop estate , that is a very high price to pay for a measure that by the government 's own admission , because they 're asking about such a big range , might n't work and might simply drive gamblers underground , into the hands of money lenders , into more dangerous environments .
so what we have to do is look at a balanced set of measures that actually address problem gamblers .

just cutting stake to £ 2 , ruining the lives of the thousands of employees who will lose their jobs , ruining the high street and the attraction betting shops provide - when it wo n't actually be of benefit to a problem gambler - that simply does n't make sense .

documents.title: wpp : clients keeping 'tight control ' on spending
text: commenting on wpp 's results , chief executive sir martin sorrell , said the world was in a `` new normal of low growth , low inflation and limited pricing power '' , which had exacerbated an emphasis on cost reduction .

he told bbc world the low growth environment was leading clients to keep a tight control on spending : `` consultants are going to clients and suggesting they 're spending too much money across the board . ''
ultra-low interest rates were `` driving pools of money into activist investing '' which ty resulted in a squeeze on companies ' budgets , he said .
he also claimed that facebook and google , growing destinations for advertisers , were not a threat to his business , and were , in fact , wpp 's biggest destination for investment .
author: BBC World

documents.title: wpp down , just eat up
text: more share movements now - and communications giant wpp 's shares are down by about 1 % after it cut its sales and profit margin forecasts for the second time in two months .
wpp said like-for-like net sales growth and operating margin would both now be flat this year , instead of increasing by
just eat 's shares are up by 2.7 % after it announced a 47 % rise in third quarter revenues .

documents.title: french gdp grows by 0.5 % in q3annual growth rate of 2.2 %
text: the french economy grew 0.5 % in the third quarter from the previous three months , the insee national statistics agency .
it means gross domestic product ( gdp ) expanded by 2.2 % over a year , the fastest pace of growth since 2011 .

documents.title: just eat revenues soar
text: and here is another company which is updating us on its financial results this morning .
just eat has reported third quarter revenues increased by 47 % to £ 138.6m , driven by strong order growth and the inclusion of skipthedishes .

its total orders were up by 29 % to 43.1 million whilst uk orders rose from 21.4 million to 26.2 million , up 22 % `` against a comparative period that was impacted by unseasonal weather conditions '' , the company said .
during the third quarter just eat 's proposed takeover of rival hungryhouse received provisional clearance from the competition and markets authority , it added .

documents.title: shares rise on company results
text: let 's check on how shares in some of the companies in the news are doing this morning .
ryanair is up by 4.24 % following the release of the airline 's third quarter results in which it said it expected to make record annual profits this year .

betting firm ladbrokes coral 's shares are 0.72 % higher , while william hill 's have jumped by 2 % - an indication that the markets do n't think the government 's review into fixed odds betting terminals will damage the industry too badly .

documents.title: wpp flat in third quarter
text: advertising group wpp has reported a 1.1 % rise in third quarter sales to £ 3.649bn , however like-for-like sales were down by 2.0 % .

the uk was the best performing region with constant currency revenue growth of 3.1 % and like-for-like growth of 1.8 % , but it slowed down compared with quarter two like-for-like growth of 5.8 % and first half like-for-like growth of 4.5 % .
in the first nine months , reported operating profits were `` well ahead of last year and operating margin up 0.1 margin points '' , it said in a statement .

documents.title: london shares up at open
text: in london shares have opened a shade higher .
the ftse 100 has edged to 7,499.33 , a rise of 12 points or 0.16 % .
the mid-cap ftse 250 is flat at 20,218.30 , a slight increase of 5 points or 0.02 % .

documents.title: bp 's third quarter profits double
text: staying with rising oil prices , energy giant bp looks set to profit from the continued upwards direction .
the company said its third-quarter underlying replacement cost profit , its definition of net income , came in at $ 1.87bn - up from $ 933m a year ago .
in the second quarter of 2017 it made $ 684m when the company took a large writedown on exploration .
the profit growth was boosted by a up in earnings from oil and gas production as a result of six big new projects begun this year .
in addition refinery profit margins rose after hurricane harvey took out about a quarter of us refining capacity for several weeks .

`` given the momentum we see across our businesses and our confidence in the outlook for the group 's finances , we will be recommencing a share buyback programme this quarter , '' chief financial officer brian gilvary said .

documents.title: 'shale output helping cap oil price rises '
text: this week oil prices have hit a two-year high above $ 60 a barrel , as the price has rocketed after opec and non-opec producers have cut back on output .
but one analyst says prices would be even higher were it not for shale oil production .
steve irwin , from industry experts portland fuel , told bbc radio five live 's wake up to money programme that `` opec cuts are having an impact '' .
`` it impedes the ability to overcome supply shocks should we have one , '' he added .
but he said : `` shale oil is helping to keep prices low , as it is bringing in a new source of supply . ''
he shale oil production in the us was now hitting six million barrels of oil a day , compared with 10.5 million barrels a day of oil output in saudi arabia .
author: BBC Radio 5 live

documents.title: ft : airbus filings on us arms trafficking rules had 'inaccuracies'the financial times tweets
text: airbus says filings for us arms trafficking rules had certain inaccuracies ''
are you looking for a professional # logo designer for your startup or established business ?
please check it out !

documents.title: minister crouch explains gambling machine probe
text: it is vital that we strike the right balance between socially responsible growth and protecting the most vulnerable , including children , from gambling-related harm .
given the strong evidence and public concerns about the risks of high stakes gaming machines on the high street , we are convinced of the need for action .
that is why today we have set out a package of proposals to ensure all consumers and wider communities are protected .
we have seen online gambling grow rapidly and we need to protect players in this space , while also making sure those experiencing harm relating to gambling receive the help they need .

documents.title: sony forecasts record profit on strong sensor sales
text: sony expects to post its highest ever profit , thanks to strong sales of parts used in smartphones .
the electronics firm is tipping operating profit of 630bn yen ( $ 5.6bn ; £ 4.2bn ) for the year ending march , up from 500bn yen previously forecast .
it also delivered better-than-expected profits for the three months to september .
sales of sensors used in smartphones and its playstation games console have boosted the japanese firm , and its pouring investment into artificial intelligence as it eyes future growth .

documents.title: bhp and vale get extension on brazil mine disaster payout
text: bhp billiton and vale have been granted an extension until 16 november by a brazilian court to negotiate a settlement on a $ 47bn ( £ 35.59bn ) claim stemming from the samarco mine disaster in 2015 .
a settlement date of 30 october had been set by a court earlier this year after the parties failed to reach an agreement by a previous deadline of 30 june .
the collapse of the dam , containing waste from an iron ore mine , killed 19 people and created a river of millions of tonnes of toxic waste .
it was brazil 's worst ever mine disaster .

on tuesday , bhp said in a statement : `` on 30 october 2017 , the court approved the extension of the date for negotiation of the settlement arrangements and an amendment to the preliminary agreement to agree on socio-economic experts to advise the federal prosecutors , to 16 november 2017 . ''

documents.title: breakinggovernment launches fixed-odds gambling consultation12-week probe to look at reducing maximum stake per play
text: the government has launched a consultation on a range of options on cutting maximum stakes of fixed odd gaming machines , otherwise known as fobts , from £ 100 to between £ 50 and £ 2 .

documents.title: ryanair 'paying pilots 20 % more than rivals '
text: ryanair has said it still expects to make record annual profits this year , despite disruptions to its schedules that led it to cancel 20,000 flights .
the airline said it made profits of €1.29bn ( £ 1.14bn ) in the six months to the end of september and forecast a full-year profit of up to €1.45bn .
the cancellations arose because pilots ' rosters had to be changed to comply with new aviation rules .
in its results , ryanair says it 's going to increase pay for pilots and it includes charts which show the airline is now paying 20 % more than its rivals norwegian and jet2 .
aviation expert john strickland of jls consulting told today that ryanair boss michael o'leary wanted to `` nail '' stories about the number of pilots who are leaving '' for rival airlines .

he added : ryanair is `` a big boeing 737 operator - it 's the same aircraft type and that is a straight `` walkover for crew '' , so if crew perceive that life is better at norwegian either financially or in terms of working arrangements they can go there . ''
he wants to persuade crew that ryanair is paying better and has `` far better '' financial prospects .
author: Today Programme
BBC Radio 4

documents.title: slashing stake 'could see 3,000 betting shops close '
text: the uk betting industry is waiting for the release of a government review into controversial fixed-odds betting terminals - which generated £ 1.8bn in revenue for bookmakers last year .
punters can stake up to £ 100 per spin on the machines , leading critics to dub them the `` crack cocaine of gambling '' - but that could be slashed to as little as £ 2 as a result of the reveiw .

gavin kelleher , gaming analyst at goodbody stockbrokers told today that if the stake was slashed to £ 2 that would knock 33 % -40 % off bookmakers ' machine revenues and `` well over half '' of bookmakers ' profits in some cases .
it would also mean £ 450m a year less in tax take .
he also said of the 8,700 bookmakers in the uk , 3,000 might close as a result : `` it may not be as bad but it would be worse as well , '' he added
author: Today Programme
BBC Radio 4

documents.title: samsung electronics posts record quarterly profit
text: samsung electronics has posted its best quarterly profit ever , driven by higher memory chip prices and a recovery in smartphone sales .
the firm 's net profit for the july to september quarter hit 11.2 trillion won ( $ 10bn ; £ 7.6bn ) .
the result nearly tripled profits reported in the same period a year earlier .
it comes weeks after chief executive kwon oh-hyun resigned from the firm , citing an `` unprecedented crisis '' .

documents.title: fixed-odds machines 'attract problem gamblers '
text: as mentioned the uk 's department of culture media and sport ( dcms ) is to release its report into the future of fixed-odds betting terminals .
there have been accusations that the machines are highly addictive , amid calls to reduce the maximum stake allowed to be cut from cut from £ 100 to just £ 2 .
`` i am hoping there will be a reduction in the stake , '' says carolyn downs , an expert in socially responsible gambling at lancaster university .
she told bbc radio five live 's wake up to money that one of main problems with the machines was the rapidity with which bets could be make .
`` people can put in money every 20 seconds . ''
she also said that another addictive lure was the number of `` near-win '' situations which occurred while playing .
although in effect financial losses , she said the excitement of nearly winning encouraged further playing on the machines .
`` the machines are particularly attractive to problem gamblers , '' she added .
author: BBC Radio 5 live

documents.title: ryanair : no repeat of pilot shortage of summer 2017
text: ryanair chief financial officer neil sorahan says he is `` absolutely '' confident the budget irish airline will have sufficient pilots and standby pilots for next summer , reuters reports .
it comes after the fiasco last month when many passengers were left stranded at their destinations because of a shortage of pilots .
the firm had to cancel more than 20,000 flights because of the shortage of cockpit crew , which ryanair had said was caused by a mix-up over rotas .
the firm now says that pilots at more than ten of its 86 bases have approved a new pay deal .
it also says that company management continues to engage with pilots , and that the previous rostering issue was human error rather than systems failure .
reuters also reports that the airline expects average fares to fall between 5 % and 6 % in the six months to the end of march .

documents.title: 'bank believes brexit could cost 75,000 finance jobs '
text: a big story from our economics editor kamal ahmed overnight .
he reports that the bank of england believes up to 75,000 jobs could be lost in financial services following britain 's departure from the european union .
he reports : `` i understand senior figures at the bank are using the number as a `` reasonable scenario '' , particularly if there is no specific uk-eu financial services deal .
`` the number could change depending on the uk 's post-brexit trading relationship with the eu .
`` but the bank still expects substantial job losses .
many jobs will move to the continent . ''
read more from kamal here .
author: Kamal Ahmed
Economics editor

documents.title: good morning
text: and welcome to tuesday 's business live page , for another busy day of news and views .
there are business updates today from ryanair , bp , wpp , and justeat later today .
and the uk 's betting industry is braced for the release of a government review into controversial fixed-odds betting terminals .
